text: So now that Ivanka and Jared (among others) are doing what Hillary Clinton did with their email, we can stop pretending all that "Lock her up" stuff was anything but a scam:
author: paulwaldman1

text:
Yes, if you were listening to @whyyradiotimes this morning my phone did go off while I was opining on the 2020 campaign, and yes, the Star Wars Imperial March is my ring tone.

I regret nothing.
author: paulwaldman1

text: Watched the HBO Theranos doc, and it doesn't communicate 1/10 of the madness and moral depravity you get from reading @JohnCarreyrou's "Bad Blood." The villainy of those like David Boies, the stupidity of the people who thought Holmes would make them rich...such a bigger story.
author: paulwaldman1

text: Was that wrong? Should I not have done that?

text: Remember that "the kind of funeral he wanted" was one at which Donald Trump didn't show up.

text: 2. I'd suggest that the experience of the last few years doesn't lend a lot of support to the persuasion hypothesis. I'm willing to be convinced that Democrats might get totally jazzed to vote for Biden, but at the moment I'm skeptical.
author: paulwaldman1

text: The "Biden is electable" argument requires you to accept that the election will be won entirely on persuasion and not on mobilization, i.e. what you want is a candidate who supposedly has some chance to win over Trump voters but about whom the Dem base will say "He's OK I guess."
author: paulwaldman1

text: Excuse me, but Team Flakes were the greatest cereal of all time.
author: paulwaldman1

text: More evidence for my rule that the way to survive any scandal is to just not resign, then wait, and eventually it will go away.
author: paulwaldman1

text: Am I the only one who watches these videos and feels nothing but sadness? These kids are filled with pain and longing because their parents have been sent away from them on one deployment after another. The kids are never joyful. They weep, and hang on in desperation.
author: paulwaldman1

text: We invaded Iraq 16 years ago today. Weirdly, Donald Trump is the only one in his party who learned anything from what happened after:
author: paulwaldman1

text: My argument for why Democrats need to keep talking about what an abomination the electoral college is, even if a constitutional amendment is a long shot:
author: paulwaldman1

text:
"Simply stated, there is no doubt that Saddam Hussein now has weapons of mass destruction. There is no doubt he is amassing them to use against our friends, against our allies, and against us."
- Dick Cheney, August 26, 2002
author: paulwaldman1

text:
I'm guessing Biden would say this was because of his desire to see the good in everybody, but boy, I don't know.

Also, as long as we're bringing up Strom Thurmond let's not forget that he sexually assaulted at least hundreds, probably thousands of women and everybody knew it.
author: paulwaldman1

text: In terms of pure dishonest bad faith, the GOP arguments in favor of the Electoral College are right up there with "These abortion restrictions are just about our concern for women's health" and "These vote restrictions targeting African-Americans are just to prevent voter fraud."
author: paulwaldman1

text: To me this is one of the rhetorical ticks that puts his insecurity about his manhood on such display. Everything has to be strong. He's not just working, he's working very strongly. Will he look at something? No, he'll look at it very strongly. Such strong looking.
author: paulwaldman1

text:
Democrats may have finally figured out what they're going to agree on when it comes to health care.

I call it Medicare For Anybody:
author: paulwaldman1

text: Leading indicator: I can now spell "Buttigieg" correctly the first time without checking. Shows he has momentum.
author: paulwaldman1

text:
Except for Bernie, the candidates have been vague on exactly what Medicare For All means to them. I'll bet this is where they converge, on Medicare For Anyone Who Wants It But You Don't Have To Take It If You Don't Want To.

M4AWWIBYDHTTIIYDWT! Rolls right off the tongue.
author: paulwaldman1

text: 3. Point is, who Republicans are afraid of is just their prediction about something that's extremely hard to predict. And they aren't exactly a bunch of geniuses. So don't take it as evidence of anything.
author: paulwaldman1

text: 2. They're also supposedly afraid of Kamala Harris, a very different candidate. And of Joe Biden, also a very different candidate.
author: paulwaldman1

text: 1. There's a lot of "Look how afraid the GOP is of Beto!" in response to this tweet. But even if it's true, be careful not to assume they have special insight into who would be most dangerous to Trump.
author: paulwaldman1

text: I actually thought Yang was a guy with some interesting things to say, but the fact that he has imbibed this inane, bad-faith Republican talking point does not speak well of him.
author: paulwaldman1

text: One of the weird things about Biden is how he swings wildly from one rhetorical extreme to another. One minute he's saying something like this, and the next he's literally challenging the president to a fistfight.
author: paulwaldman1

text: If I could take every primary voter by the shoulders and tell them one thing it would be this: Don't support the candidate you're guessing other people will like. Support the candidate you like.
author: paulwaldman1
